summary: This document is a chain of internal FBI emails from July-August 2020 in which the New York Field Office's Squad C-20 (VCACIHT) requests assistance from other agents for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation, describing it as a 'unique opportunity' and 'high profile case'. The emails show coordination for discovery preparation and project completion deadlines.

persons.name: Special Agent
persons.context: The FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office's Child Exploitation/Human Trafficking unit who responds to an offer of assistance, outlining tasks related to organizing and prepping for discovery in the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

connections.description: Both are FBI Special Agents in the New York Field Office involved in coordinating assistance for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

events.title: FBI Request for Assistance on Epstein/Maxwell Case
events.description: Squad C-20 (VCACIHT) in the FBI New York Field Office sends an email requesting assistance from other agents for the ongoing Epstein/Maxwell investigation, calling it a high-profile case and a unique opportunity.

events.title: Follow-up on Investigation Assistance
events.description: An FBI agent follows up on a previous email, offering to come in early before shift to pick up work related to the Epstein/Maxwell investigation.

locations: 290 (referenced as a location where the agent will be early in the morning, likely an FBI office or facility)
keyFacts: The FBI's New York Field Office Squad C-20 (VCACIHT) was actively seeking assistance from other agents for the Epstein/Maxwell investigation as of July 2020.
The investigation was described internally as a 'high profile case' and a 'unique opportunity' for agents to assist.
Key tasks involved 'getting organized and prepping for discovery' with projects needing completion by the end of August 2020.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination and resource allocation for a major child exploitation/human trafficking investigation.
